answers.answer: Hi,Hidradenitis suppurativa is usually diagnosed clinically and may initially be diagnosed as a boil or folliculitis.However these lesions may eventually show that they do not respond well to antimicrobial therapy.Would you be able to elaborate more on your symptoms?How would you describe your symptoms?Where are the skin lesions located and how were you diagnosed with your physician?Any underlying disease like weight problems or diabetes?Do kep us posted with your answers.

question: I recently saw a doctor about hidranitis suppuritiva and was told it was a low white blood cell count,and that the only thing that could help is the dove body wash but can not be cured.This discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/239907.
